channel.title: Apartment Therapy | Saving the world, one room at a time
channel.description: Saving the world, one room at a time

item.title: White Armoire Similar to Dwell Studio's Gate? — Good Questions
item.description:
Q: I'm in love, LOVE I tell you, with Dwell Studio's Gate Armoire. I love it so much that I'd even be willing to make the splurge... if I could get  it in white. *Sigh*. So, Apartment Therapy design-a-nistas, please help me find something that is similar. (I would never paint something so lovely as Dwell Studio —- other things yes, this, no). What do I love about this piece, in particular? The fretwork makes my heart flutter. And the fact that it is on lovely legs and not so HEAVY on the floor makes it just perfect to me. So, can you find me the next best thing to my true love?

More
item.author: Regina Yunghans

item.title: Kids Room Trend: White Lace Bedrooms
item.description:
Lace is a big decor trend for 2013, and children's rooms are no different. White lace looks clean and comfortable in any setting. It needn't be all about soft dreaminess. Paired with modern pieces, lace also works for a more vintage, eclectic space. Here's a round up of inspirational bedrooms, along with some available lace decor for you to get the look.

More
item.author: Dabney Frake

item.title: Does IKEA Actually Sell this Chaise? — Good Questions
item.description:
Q: IKEA's US website includes this robin's egg blue chaise lounger as a "seating solution" in the site's idea section, yet over the past few months I've been unable to locate it. Does IKEA even make it, or is it an upcoming release? Or does anyone know who actually makes it? I'm looking for an affordable chaise and this one actually is the style and color that works perfectly in my space... really hoping to find it!

More
item.author: Regina Yunghans

item.title: Green Inspiration: Teacup Garden — The Inspired Room
item.description:
This adorable mini garden from Melissa at The Inspired Room was assembled in five minutes flat, and makes for a pretty spring accent for your dining table or windowsill.

More
item.author: Linda Ly

item.title: Get the Look: Spring Flowers
item.description:
Flowers are always a sign of spring, and this year we're feeling old-fashioned prints — think oversized roses and tapestry florals. Used in unexpected ways in modern interiors (or outfits!), these lush prints feel especially fresh. 

More
item.author: Nancy Mitchell

item.title: Inheriting Hobbies, or How I Got My Green Thumb
item.description:
My parents came to visit this Saturday. That afternoon I bought a new fig plant for my sitting room, clematis for my backyard, and daffodils to put in the guest bedroom. I smiled to myself when my mom and dad brought me a begonia and a hyacinth. We love plants.

More
item.author: Kim Rinehimer

item.title: Small Space Gardening: 5 Online Resources
item.description:
If you're lucky enough to have some outdoor space, now's the time to start putting it to use. Or at least lay the groundwork. Once Memorial Day rolls around, you'll want that little outdoor escape, even if it's just a fire escape or front stoop. These five stores have great online catalogs to help you get started ... and you never even have to leave your living room.

More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: Shop the Room: Relaxed Modern Dining Room
item.description:
Every little thing about the dining room in Thomas and Stephanie's Comfortably Modern Home comes together beautifully. From the rug to the light fixture, this room pulls together different textures to great effect. Check out the source list after the jump to achieve the look in your own home.

More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: My Tech Top 10: Jaime Derringer and Caroline Williamson of Design Milk
item.description:
Design Milk, a longtime favorite site of mine, describes itself as "always fresh + never sour", and I can't disagree. Their fortified daily feed spans from the world of art to design to architecture and beyond all with a modernist's sensibility (but I think as an animal lover, I may enjoy their pet site, Dog Milk, a whisker more). Founder Jaime Derringer and associate editor Caroline Williamson were kind enough to share their daily tech tool favorites all within arm's reach of their desk, splitting our usual My Tech Top in half...

More
item.author: Gregory Han

item.title: 10 Tried & True Tips: How to Make New Friends in a New City
item.description:
Earlier this week, Jennifer wrote about leaving her friends behind because of a big cross-country move. I made a similar big move nearly four years ago, following my now husband from San Diego to Seattle when he started his exciting new career. The hardest part for me? Making new friends. It sure isn't as easy as it used to be!

More
item.author: AnnaMaria Stephens

item.title: Claire & Jeffrey's Kitchen: Cabinets and Countertops — Renovation Diary
item.description:
Name: Claire & Jeffrey
Type of Project: Kitchen remodel
Location: Minneapolis, Minnesota
Type of building: Single-family bungalow, 950 square feet

The Renovation Diaries are a new collaboration with our community in which we feature your step by step renovation progress and provide monetary support towards getting it done in style. See all of our Reno Diaries here.

SO MUCH IS HAPPENING.

Cabinets went up in a flash as soon as the drywall was cleaned up enough for a level surface. IKEA cabinets are great to work with and super straightforward. I only hammered my thumb, like, twice.

More
item.author: Guest

item.title: Angie & Josh's Cat & Design Friendly Home — House Tour
item.description:
Name: Contract Specialist Angie Lucia and Graphic Designer Josh Gomby
Location: Silver Spring, Maryland
Size: 850 square feet
Years lived in: 1 year, 6 mos, Renting

I met Angie on my first day of college, years ago, when she was the RA (Resident Assistant) of my dormitory in Maryland. I discovered she had great taste in music by the selection of indie bands she was playing in her room. What I didn't know was that years later I would be invited into the home that she shares with her husband Josh, and discover her equally excellent taste in home decor and graphic design. 

More
item.author: Nicole Crowder

item.title: Delicious Decor: Geode Lamp, Buddha & Turtle Shell — The Thursday Afternoon Scavenger
item.description:
These are guaranteed to be the most interesting thing in the room. Present company excluded of course.
  • Boston, MA: Gold Buddha Head - $80
  • Brooklyn, NY: Geode Lamp - $50
  • San Francisco, CA: African Juju Feather - $300
  • Minneapolis, MN: Natural Turtle Shell - $73
  • Los Angeles, CA: Jere Style Brass Sailboat - $450
    More
item.author: Dabney Frake

item.title: Ideas for Making Corner Fireplace the Focal Point? — Good Questions
item.description:
Q: My husband and I will be moving into our new 875 square foot apartment in a few weeks. It's great, but I want to use the space to the max. I am not sure how to arrange the seating (we don't have any furniture now) in the combined living/dining room area, since there is a built in corner fireplace in the living room. 

More
item.author: Regina Yunghans

item.title: DIY Idea: Colorful String Cord Covers
item.description:
You try and try to keep cords under wraps. But sometimes – maybe thanks to a houseguest, party, outdoor screening setup or just an awful floorplan –you've got no other option but to let the wires lay where they may. You can at least give them a facelift from boring beige to something a little more colorful and decor-enhancing.

More
item.author: Taryn Fiol

item.title: Cute IKEA Hack: Stool Turned Kid's Bike — Design News 04.04.13
item.description:
Who knew that ubiquitous Frosta stools could be turned into a cool kid's bike? Two IKEA hackers collaborated on turning a pair of basic stools into a fun toy. The wheels, which are modified from the seats, roll perfectly, even if the handlebar legs are a bit stiff. The duo posted the project on Instructables. 

In other news, 40 years ago, the first cell phone call was made, and New York's most expensive listing is asking $125 million. See the headlines after the jump.

More
item.author: Tara Bellucci

item.title: Frank's Depression-Era Modern Home in Franklin Hills — House Tour
item.description:
Name: Frank Novak, Co-owner of Modernica
Location: Franklin Hills, Los Angeles, California
Size: 1,800 square feet
Years lived in: 18 years

You may have met Frank at his store, Modernica, or you may have seen him running around during the craziness of their factory sale downtown. Those who have had the pleasure of meeting him know that he is very knowledgable about collecting antiques, Mid-Century furniture, and California design. 

More
item.author: Marcia Prentice

item.title: 15 Repurposed Planters: Just Add Dirt
item.description: When you see so many pictures of productive gardens in big backyards, it's easy to forget that gorgeous gardens also happen in small yards and surprising places. These 15 repurposed planters remind us that you don't need a lot of space and new materials to start growing your own garden; all you need is a little bit of ingenuity and resolve. More
item.author: Sarah Starkey

item.title: SPONSORED POST: Style Source: Spring 2013 Trends From Surya — Surya
item.description:
One of the key components of style success is knowing where to source the latest and greatest innovative design. If you haven't already added them to your arsenal of great sources, Surya is one of our faves for on-trend rugs, poufs, pillows, throws and art. Releasing brand new designs each season and sticking to quality craftsmanship keeps Surya at the top of our list for colorful, fashion-forward home accessories. Surya products can be purchased at leading furniture and interior design stores nationwide.

So what's fresh for spring 2013? Find out as we explore Surya's collection, and discover how easy it is to take your own space from outdated to updated!
More
item.author: Sponsored Post

item.title: Scandinavian Folk Style Kids' Decor
item.description:
Do you ever feel nostalgia for something you never experienced? Perhaps in another life I grew up on a Swedish farm taking fika breaks with my mormor. Anyhow, I'm drawn to the homey style of Scandinavian folk and think it's particularly sweet in children's rooms. 

More
item.author: Carrie McBride

item.title: What Do Your Parents Think of Your Home?
item.description:
My parents are visiting me in San Francisco for the first time, which means seeing my apartment for the first time. It is with great relief that I can say that they love it, although part of that might be due to lowered expectations. They knew it was 400 square feet, but as my dad said, "We thought it would be half this size, just a bed and a fridge!"

More
item.author: Tess Wilson

item.title: Indoor Exercise in Apartments: Tips for Reducing the Noisy Nuisance?
item.description:
I think I might be getting slightly addicted to some cable exercise videos. I'm not ashamed to admit it, although I'm sure my downstairs neighbor is getting an earful of my sporadic jumping about at 6am. What's a fitness junkie to do?

More
item.author: Andie Powers

item.title: One Design, Two Budgets: Organic Modern Bedroom
item.description:
Rustic wood, natural materials, and a bit of living greenery give a bedroom a serene, touch of spring feel. Whether your budget is large or a bit less, you can get an Organic Modern room that's both restful and awakening.

More
item.author: Tara Bellucci

item.title: Cloth & Goods — Store Profile
item.description:
Over her years of travel as a stylist and interior designer, Melissa Newirth has been a casual collector of vintage textiles. The growing collection sparked a desire to turn the textiles into modern wares. Thus, Cloth & Goods, an online shop offering a mix of new and vintage textiles and home goods, was born. 

More
item.author: Jason Loper

item.title: The Look for Less: DIY Tripod Floor Lamp — Do or DIY
item.description: To turn a "splurge" into a huge "save," you have to be a little lucky. Finding the right vintage elements to repurpose for DIY projects is a tough challenge, to be sure. But if you're in the right place — Craigslist — at the right time — constantly — you just might make a huge score. More
item.author: Taryn Fiol
